title: 6-year-old injured in south Sacramento shooting
content:
SACRAMENTO, Calif. (KCRA) —
A 6-year-old girl was shot Tuesday night near the intersection of Fruitridge Road and Lawrence Drive in south Sacramento.
The shooting happened about 7:30 p.m. The girl was in a car with her mother when someone in a white SUV or van opened fire, according to the Sacramento County Sheriff's Department.
The girl was shot in the arm, and her mother took her to a hospital, officers said.
The child was out of surgery by Tuesday night and was expected to make a full recovery, deputies said.
No information about a gunman has been released.
No other details have been released.
